item.title: Cory Booker Weds Alexis Lewis in a Private Ceremony
item.description: The couple legally married at a courthouse in Newark days before hosting an intimate wedding in Washington, D.C. on Saturday. They shared their wedding details exclusively with The New York Times.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

item.title: El giro de Marjorie Taylor Greene
item.description: No, no estamos viendo un renacimiento político ni una historia positiva sobre la desprogramación de los fieles al MAGA.
item.dc:creator: Tressie McMillan Cottom

media:content.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times

item.title: America Has Sidelined Education. You Can Help.
item.description: The New York Times Communities Fund has partnered with charities that invest in education at critical junctures across people’s life spans.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

media:content.media:credit: Kyle Myles for The New York Times

item.title: How We Became ‘Half in Love With Easeful Death’
item.description: Apocalyptic predictions may actually serve as comforting fantasies, at which point our future freakouts become an excuse for inaction.
item.dc:creator: Christine Emba
item.category: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research

item.title: Fed Up With the Taliban, Pakistan Expels Masses of Afghans
item.description: Labeling Afghans a national security threat, Pakistan has forced out about a million this year, depriving them of a haven from Afghanistan’s turmoil.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier, Zia ur-Rehman and Asim Hafeez

media:content.media:credit: Asim Hafeez for The New York Times

item.title: Quote of the Day: ‘Group’ Is a Gift Still Treasured After 44 Years
item.description: Quotation of the Day for November 30, 2025.

item.title: No Corrections: Nov. 30, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Sunday, Nov. 30, 2025.

item.title: 4 Dead After Shooting at Banquet Hall in California
item.description: The shooting in Stockton, a city in California’s Central Valley, left 11 others wounded. The authorities said they were looking for a suspect.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:credit: Ethan Swope/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officers at the scene of a shooting in Stockton, Calif., on Saturday.

item.title: Trump Frees Fraudster Just Days Into Seven-Year Prison Sentence
item.description: David Gentile had been found guilty for his role in what prosecutors described as a $1.6 billion scheme that defrauded thousands of investors.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth P. Vogel

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump commuted the sentence of David Gentile.

item.title: Webster Springs, W.Va. United In Grief Over Death of National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom
item.description: In Webster Springs, everyone knows one another. When National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was killed, that connection was even further strengthened.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Williams and Jacey Fortin

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Jackson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A vigil was held Saturday for Specialist Sarah Beckstrom, a West Virginia Army National Guard soldier.

item.title: The Ex-President Whom Trump Plans to Pardon Flooded America With Cocaine
item.description: Juan Orlando Hernández, whom Mr. Trump called a victim of persecution, helped orchestrate a decades-long trafficking conspiracy. It ravaged his Central American country.
item.dc:creator: Santul Nerkar, Annie Correal and Colin Moynihan

media:content.media:credit: Getty Images/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: When Juan Orlando Hernández was extradited to the United States, his own country erupted in celebration.

item.title: The Language of Tom Stoppard, Ablaze With Energy and Urgency
item.description: In works like “Travesties” and “Arcadia,” the playwright embraced the really big questions and wrestled words into coherent, exhilarating shape.
item.dc:creator: Ben Brantley

media:content.media:credit: Charlie Gates for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Tom Stoppard, in 2022, photographed at his home in Dorset, England.

item.title: Hog Wild
item.description: Natan Last’s puzzle is a gem.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:credit: Rick Nederstigt/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: An apple a day keeps the vet away! Three pigs shared some apples on an organic farm in the Netherlands.

item.title: Top Trump Aides to Meet With Ukrainians in Florida on Sunday
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner plan to discuss peace terms again after an uproar over a 28-point proposal drafted with Russian input.
item.dc:creator: Edward Wong

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio will attend talks with Ukrainian officials in Florida on Sunday.

item.title: Afghans Who Assisted U.S. During the War Underwent Rigorous Vetting
item.description: Former officials said the C.I.A. diligently assessed those who partnered with its forces, like the man accused of shooting two National Guard members in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes and Hamed Aleaziz
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: John Ratcliffe, the C.I.A. director, said the man accused of shooting two National Guard members, an Afghan who had worked with U.S. forces during the war in his country, “should have never been allowed to come here.”

item.title: Major Winter Storm Dumps Snow Across Midwest and Upends Travel
item.description: More than 1,100 flights were canceled at Chicago airports as the storm disrupted travel for those headed home after Thanksgiving.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff and Robert Chiarito

media:content.media:credit: Kiichiro Sato/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Chicago was getting snow on Saturday and might get an accumulation of six to 10 inches, forecasters said. The city has not experienced a significant late-November winter storm in four or five years.

item.title: Utah Hiker Rescued With His Children Faces Abuse and Torture Charges
item.description: The man was initially hailed for his efforts to protect his daughter, 8, and two sons, 4 and 2, but the authorities concluded that he put them at risk by taking them on perilous terrain.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz

media:content.media:credit: Cayce Clifford for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Big Cottonwood Canyon, near where Micah Smith took his three children hiking on a steep mountainous trail in Salt Lake County, Utah.

item.title: Russia Attacks Ukraine in a 10-Hour Deadly Assault
item.description: A Russian air assault across Ukraine on Saturday killed at least two people and injured dozens more, according to the Ukrainian authorities.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:credit: Genya Savilov/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A damaged residential building following an air attack in Kyiv on Saturday.

item.title: Several Arrested as Protesters Block ICE Agents From a Potential Raid in NYC
item.description: The confrontation appeared to foil a possible ICE raid nearby, underscoring the numerous challenges the federal government faces in trying to stage raids in a dense city like New York.
item.dc:creator: Maia Coleman, Wesley Parnell and Luis Ferré-Sadurní

media:content.media:credit: Todd Heisler/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The scene of the protest was just blocks from where a large-scale immigration raid took place last month.

item.title: In Announcing Pardon of Drug Trafficker While Threatening Venezuela, Trump Displays Contradictions
item.description: President Trump’s statements on social media less than 24 hours apart showed the dissonance in his campaign against drug trafficking.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump spoke during a video call with military service members on Thursday.

item.title: L.A. Man Is Charged With Stopping Freeway Traffic to Film Music Video
item.description: The closure happened in 2023, prosecutors said. As part of the video, drivers conducted doughnuts around a performer, who was charged with conspiracy to commit exhibition of speed.
item.dc:creator: Mark Walker

media:content.media:credit: Kendrick Brinson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The 110 Freeway, past downtown Los Angeles. Prosecutors said that a man stopped traffic on it in 2023 so he could record a music video.

item.title: Colleen Jones, Curling Champion and Broadcaster, Dies at 65
item.description: She won two world titles and six Canadian national championships, and was also a television anchor, reporter and commentator.
item.dc:creator: Jeré Longman

media:content.media:credit: Andy Clark AC/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Colleen Jones during a curling match in 2002. She was inducted into Canada’s Sports Hall of Fame in 2016.

item.title: The Grand Ole Opry Toasts 100 Years and Considers What’s Next
item.description: A hundred years after it first went live, Nashville’s famed country music show celebrated its history with a series of performances.
item.dc:creator: Emily Cochrane

item.title: Trump declara cerrado el espacio aéreo de Venezuela
item.description: El presidente Trump dijo días antes que la campaña de Estados Unidos de ataques letales en el mar a personas sospechosas de narcotráfico podría ampliarse “muy pronto” a atacar territorio venezolano.
item.dc:creator: Helene Cooper and Julian E. Barnes

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump habló con Nicolás Maduro, líder de Venezuela, la semana pasada, según dos personas con conocimiento de la conversación.

item.title: Gazans Say Israeli Forces Killed Two Children, Amid Persistent Violence
item.description: The Israeli military said it had fired on two “suspects” on Saturday who had crossed cease-fire lines in southern Gaza and did not comment on reports that they were young children.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman and Rawan Sheikh Ahmad

media:content.media:credit: Abdel Kareem Hana/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Displaced Palestinians standing by a fire beside their tent in Gaza City on Friday.

item.title: U.S. Black Friday Sales Defy Tariffs and Economic Woes
item.description: Data on spending this week shows that consumers are shopping big for the holidays despite inflation and economic worries.
item.dc:creator: Kailyn Rhone

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Shoppers outside the Macy’s flagship store in Midtown Manhattan on Black Friday afternoon.

item.title: Tom Stoppard, Award-Winning Playwright of Witty Drama, Dies at 88
item.description: Drawing comparisons to the greatest of dramatists, he entwined erudition with imagination in stage works that won accolades on both sides of the Atlantic.
item.dc:creator: Bruce Weber

media:content.media:credit: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Tom Stoppard in 1992. He earned a reputation as the most cerebral of contemporary English-language playwrights, venturing into vast fields of scholarly inquiry.

item.title: Mourners Honor Victims of Hong Kong Apartment Fire
item.description: The police said they expected the death toll of 128 to rise as the authorities began combing through the charred apartment towers.
item.dc:creator: Anjali Tsui

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: People affected by the fire at a shelter on Friday.

item.title: ‘I’ve Never Eaten, Let Alone Made, a Better Sugar Cookie’
item.description: Readers love Samantha Seneviratne’s soft and chewy sugar cookies, and so do I.
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Vanni for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Samantha Seneviratne.
media:content.media:description: Samantha Seneviratne’s soft and chewy sugar cookies.

item.title: Cómo vivir hasta los 100 años, según Dick Van Dyke
item.description: La estrella de “Mary Poppins” y “Chitty Chitty Bang Bang” sigue yendo al gimnasio y tocándose los dedos de los pies.
item.dc:creator: Jancee Dunn

item.title: Cookie Week Cookie Recipes From Years Past
item.description: And all through the house, not a baker was stirring — yet.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Johnny Miller for The New York Times. Food Stylist:Samantha Seneviratne.
media:content.media:description: Vaughn Vreeland’s Mexican hot chocolate cookies.

item.title: Trump Declares Venezuelan Airspace Closed
item.description: President Trump said days earlier that the United States could “very soon” expand its campaign of killing people at sea suspected of drug trafficking to attacking Venezuelan territory.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes and Helene Cooper

media:content.media:credit: Adriana Loureiro Fernandez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump spoke with Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s leader, last week, according to two people with knowledge of the discussion.

item.title: Did Pope Leo Pray in Istanbul’s Blue Mosque? Not Visibly, at Least.
item.description: Leo XIV is being closely watched on an inaugural trip to Turkey and Lebanon to spread a message of peace and outreach.
item.dc:creator: Motoko Rich

media:content.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Pope Leo XIV visiting the Sultan Ahmed Mosque in Istanbul on Saturday.

item.title: Walter Dowdle, Public Health Leader in Times of Crises, Dies at 94
item.description: Dr. Dowdle, a microbiologist who became the No. 2 official at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, helped lead the nation’s response to AIDS.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

item.title: Inside the ‘Morgue’ at The New York Times
item.description: Take a tour of the newspaper’s vast archive.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Abrams, Brendan Klinkenberg, Alyssa Moxley and Jeff Roth

media:content.media:credit: Michelle V. Agins/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Jeff Roth is the caretaker of The Times’s “morgue,” a vast archive that houses the paper’s historical news clippings and photographic prints, and other archival materials.

item.title: The Quest for Perfection Is Stunting Our Society
item.description: It is not only classical musicians who are being harmed by the search for perfection. It is harming many aspects of our lives and sectors of our society.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Biss

media:content.media:credit: Rory Doyle for The New York Times

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: NICU Parents Need Your Help
item.description: The organization provides critical support to families of sick newborns, making a lonely and devastating experience a little less so.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Grose

item.title: The Salmon That Surprised Everyone
item.description: Although nature is sometimes very fragile, decades of conservation rhetoric have perhaps overstated that fragility.
item.dc:creator: Emma Marris

item.title: How I Began to Love Reading Again
item.description: I needed to stop thinking that I knew more than the author and give in to whatever ride they had spent years planning.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Giles

item.title: How Diaries Can Help Beat Back Artificial Intelligence
item.description: In a world taken over by the digital, hard-copy, handwritten diaries are a way to fight back.
item.dc:creator: Lily Koppel

media:content.media:credit: Debora Szpilman

item.title: Trump Misunderstands the Education Department’s History
item.description: The U.S. first had a federal education department in 1867 — not 1979. Its history is critical in understanding the federal role in schools.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Conwright

media:content.media:credit: Marie Hansen/The LIFE Picture Collection/Shutterstock

item.title: Highlight Reel
item.description: As the year comes to a close, we want to know your highly specific, idiosyncratic bests of 2025.

item.title: Fresh Reporting on Asylum Seekers at the U.S.-Canadian Border
item.description: Canada has made its border with the United States tougher to cross. Here’s what we learned through monthlong reporting on a single case.
item.dc:creator: Matina Stevis-Gridneff

media:content.media:credit: Ian Willms for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Rahel Negassi at her new home in Kitchener, Ontario. She has applied for her Ontario nurse permit, and she hopes to be able to work soon.

item.title: In Firing His No. 2, Zelensky Loses Both a Negotiator and an Enforcer
item.description: Andriy Yermak had ensured internal discipline in Ukraine’s wartime politics. He also led the country’s peace negotiations, which now must go on without him.
item.dc:creator: Andrew E. Kramer

media:content.media:credit: Tyler Hicks/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A Ukrainian soldier in the eastern Donbas region. Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s former chief of staff, had negotiated to soften a peace proposal that included withdrawing from territory in eastern Ukraine.

item.title: ‘The Interview’: Simon Cowell Is Sorry, Softer and Grieving Liam Payne
item.description: The music mogul has mellowed as he thinks about his legacy.
item.dc:creator: Lulu Garcia-Navarro

media:content.media:credit: David Vintiner for The New York Times

item.title: Trump intensifica sus posturas antiinmigración tras el tiroteo en Washington
item.description: El presidente de EE. UU. ha sumado el ataque a los integrantes de la Guardia Nacional a su visión respecto a los migrantes.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El tiroteo a dos miembros de la Guardia Nacional y la respuesta del presidente Trump aseguran que la inmigración seguirá estando en el centro de la política estadounidense de cara al ciclo de elecciones legislativas de 2026.

item.title: La IA ayuda a identificar al asesino de una ejecución durante el régimen nazi
item.description: Según Jürgen Matthäus, investigador del Holocausto, el asesino era Jakobus Onnen, de 34 años, un antiguo profesor de la ciudad de Tichelwarf, cerca de la frontera alemana con los Países Bajos.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Nazaryan
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:credit: Associated Press
media:content.media:description: La foto fue sacada a la luz por un sobreviviente del Holocausto, Al Moss, durante el juicio del oficial nazi Adolf Eichmann.
